issue_name: Loose and Missing Mortar in Foundation Walls
issue_description: There is loose and missing mortar between the stones of the original foundation walls in some locations on the north side of the basement, particularly near the electrical panels at the northwest corner.
issue_summary: The joints should be cleaned and filled with mortar. This type of problem is invariably a result of long term moisture seepage through the foundation walls.
additional_information: Exterior grading and eavestrough repairs must be completed on the north side of the building.
issue_images: Loose and Missing Mortar in Foundation Walls

issue_description: Evidence of past and active water seepage problems were noted through the foundation walls on the north and south sides of the basement.
issue_summary: The seepage signs noted will be due in part to improper surface drainage on the north and south sides. Grading improvements are recommended on the exterior.
additional_information: The poorly functioning eavestroughs and downspouts in all locations will allow excessive water accumulation near the foundation and the system should be replaced.

issue_description: Due to the long term nature of the seepage problem near the electrical panels on the north side of the basement, it may be necessary to excavate below grade level in the narrow walkway on the exterior.
issue_summary: Excavation and waterproofing the original stone foundation wall may be necessary to completely eliminate the water seepage problem in this area of the basement.
additional_information: A dehumidifier should be operated in the basement during the summer months to minimize humidity and condensation problems.

issue_description: Severe dryrot damage was noted to some of the few visible floor joists in the ceiling at the front of the basement.
issue_summary: It is suspected that this deterioration occurred many years ago, possibly when the front of the building was simply a crawl space.
additional_information: Many of the floor joists have been doubled-up to replace the support. Some sections of the sill plates and floor joist ends may have been damaged due to long term moisture seepage.

issue_description: The cracked and poorly sloped narrow concrete walkway on the north side should be replaced to properly control all surface water in this area.
issue_summary: The old basement window well opening in this area should be filled in with masonry.
additional_information: Consideration should be given to water-proofing the upper section of the stone foundation wall.

issue_name: Poor Condition of Eavestroughs and Downspouts
issue_description: Due to the overall poor condition of the eavestroughs and downspouts servicing the front pitched roof on the north and south sides, immediate replacement is recommended.
issue_summary: The system must be kept free of debris and checked regularly for loose sections and leaky seams.
additional_information: The condition of the underground downspout drain pipe at the rear on the north side should be verified.
issue_images: Poor Condition of Eavestroughs and Downspouts

issue_description: Water staining was noted at the base of the main disconnect switch box and also in the splitter box.
issue_summary: The main disconnect switch box could not be opened due to corrosion and it will likely have to be replaced.
additional_information: All wiring connections in the main disconnect switch box and in the splitter box should be examined and repairs must be completed as required.

issue_description: Amateurish wiring was noted throughout the building. Dangling electrical wires and junction boxes were noted in the basement and above many of the ceilings.
issue_summary: It is recommended that an electrician review the wiring and make the necessary repairs.
additional_information: Some corroding armoured BX cable was noted on the north side of the basement and should be replaced.

issue_description: A distinct smell of gas was detected in the basement.
issue_summary: The distribution piping and gas meter at the front of the basement should be examined to determine the exact source of the leak and make the necessary repairs.
additional_information: All amateurishly installed and poorly supported gas pipes on the roof of the building should be repaired or replaced as required.

issue_description: Poor air movement was detected through the supply-air registers and diffusers in some locations.
issue_summary: There is not any return-air ductwork connected to the two high-efficiency furnaces on the second floor.
additional_information: All ductwork should be examined with future renovations and repairs should be completed as required.

issue_description: Given the overall poor condition of the sump pump, replacement with a higher quality pump is recommended.
issue_summary: The drain pipe connection at the floor level leaks and it must be repaired.
additional_information: There should be a proper cover over the sump pump reservoir.

issue_description: Asbestos insulating material appears to be present around some of the abandoned heating pipes in the basement ceiling.
issue_summary: The edges of the insulation are in a deteriorated state and they should be removed or encapsulated.
additional_information: All deteriorated sections of asbestos bearing insulation should be appropriately removed with any renovations.
